function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"The use of de-spatialization and spatialization in pandemic control may lead to a misunderstanding of the objectives and strategies in disease prevention.","Impact":"Misunderstanding the objectives and strategies in disease prevention can lead to ineffective measures and increased risk of disease spread.","Mitigation":"Provide clear and specific guidelines on the use of de-spatialization and spatialization in pandemic control, and offer training to ensure understanding of the differences and their implications for disease prevention.","Technologies":"Clear communication strategies, training programs, and educational materials to support understanding of pandemic control strategies.","People":"Public health officials, policymakers, and researchers working on pandemic control strategies.","Owner":"Public health organizations, government agencies, and research institutions."},{"Description":"Automation and use of driverless vehicles and robots may lead to a reduction in the availability of human resources for pandemic prevention and control.","Impact":"Reduced availability of human resources can limit the capacity to respond to emerging disease outbreaks and implement effective control measures.","Mitigation":"Develop contingency plans for deploying human resources in emergency situations, invest in workforce training for pandemic response, and explore hybrid models combining automation with human involvement.","Technologies":"Workforce management systems, training programs for emergency response, and human-robot collaboration technologies.","People":"Emergency response teams, public health organizations, and technology developers.","Owner":"Government agencies, public health organizations, and technology companies."}]}
